intro: Marcus-kochia ramosissima, commonly known as the silverleaf kochia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and branching stems that become more pronounced with age. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in late summer, which are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Marcus-kochia ramosissima is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that is well adapted to arid environments.
